articles.author: Scott  MacFarlane
articles.title: Rep. Eric Swalwell sues housing official who's made multiple criminal referrals for Trump critics - CBS News
articles.description: Trump housing official Bill Pulte also submitted criminal referrals for investigations into Sen. Adam Schiff, New York Attorney General Letitia James and Federal Reserve Board member Lisa Cook.

articles.author: WSJ Staff, Heard Editors, Richard Rubin, Sam Goldfarb, Dan Gallagher, Gunjan Banerji, Stephen Wilmot, Jesse Newman, Ed Ballard, Matt Grossman, Harriet Torry, Spencer Jakab, Eliot Brown
articles.title: Stock Market Today: Nasdaq Sinks; Nvidia Drops as Alphabet Rallies on AI Chip Rivalry — Live Updates - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Follow along for live updates on the Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq and other markets.

articles.author: Dina Bass
articles.title: HP Announces Job Cuts as Profit Outlook Falls Short of Estimates - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: HP Inc. gave a profit outlook for current year that fell short of estimates and the company said it will cut 4,000 to 6,000 employees through fiscal 2028 by using more AI tools.

articles.author: Ryan J. Reilly, Frank Thorp V, Kyle Stewart, Brennan Leach
articles.title: FBI seeks interviews with six Democrats Trump accused of 'seditious behavior' - NBC News
articles.description: The lawmakers, who had released a video urging members of the military and intelligence community not to follow illegal orders, accused Trump of trying to intimidate them.

articles.author: Leo Sands
articles.title: Four more detained in Louvre heist as fate of jewels remains unknown - The Washington Post
articles.description: Four others have already been charged over the Louvre jewelry theft. There is no sign that the jewels have been recovered as questions swirl about security lapses.

articles.author: Terry Pluto, cleveland.com
articles.title: Shedeur Sanders: He’s No. 12. He’s No. 42. Let’s hope he can be No. 1 for a while – Terry Pluto - Cleveland.com
articles.description: Shedeur Sanders is the 42nd QB to start for the Browns since the franchise returned in 1999.

articles.author: Andrew Cunningham
articles.title: Spiking memory prices mean that it is once again a horrible time to build a PC - Ars Technica
articles.description: Some RAM kits are over three times as expensive as they were three months ago.

articles.author: Meagan Flynn, Jonathan O'Connell, Jenny Gathright
articles.title: D.C. Mayor Bowser will not run for fourth term - The Washington Post
articles.description: Bowser, who has led D.C. over a turbulent decade, will not seek reelection in 2026, a decision bound to open up a highly competitive mayoral race.

articles.title: Why Google's Challenge To Nvidia Is 'Intriguing' For Amazon's AI Chip Push - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: Amazon stock is trying to bounce-back from a recent sell-off as its annual cloud conference approaches. Its AI chips will be in focus.

articles.author: Luke Fountain
articles.title: Trump pardons Thanksgiving turkeys, blasts Biden and says Ukraine peace deal is ‘very close’ - CNBC
articles.description: Thanksgiving turkey prices have climbed this year, the first of President Donald Trump's second term in the White House.

articles.author: Rachel Treisman
articles.title: The case against Comey failed because of Trump's prosecutor. Who is she? - NPR
articles.description: A federal judge dismissed the Justice Department's cases against James Comey and Letitia James, saying the prosecutor who led them was unlawfully appointed. Here's what to know about her.

articles.title: Department of the Interior Announces Modernized, More Affordable National Park Access - U.S. Department of the Interior (.gov)
articles.description: The Department of the Interior today announced the most significant modernization of national park access in decades, delivering new digital America the Beautiful passes, updated annual pass artwork, expanded motorcycle access and a new resident-focused fee s…

articles.author: Ashley Belanger
articles.title: RealPage agrees to change algorithm so landlords can’t collude on price hikes - Ars Technica
articles.description: RealPage agrees to settle suit over DOJ claims software raised rents across the US.

articles.author: McKinley Franklin
articles.title: Inside the ‘Dancing With the Stars’ Mega Comeback and Secret to Season 34’s Viral Success - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: In conversation with The Hollywood Reporter, showrunner Conrad Green and casting director Deena Katz dish on how much social media and TikTok have contributed to the season's virality, why influencers are their modern day “celebrity” and if Tom Bergeron could…

articles.author: Duarte  Dias
articles.title: Australian Senator Pauline Hanson banned from parliament for 7 days for wearing burqa to demand they be banned - CBS News
articles.description: Senator Pauline Hanson banned from parliament for 7 days for wearing burqa in the chamber to demand they be banned nationally.

articles.author: Diana Nerozzi
articles.title: Trump wants peace in Ukraine, no matter what a deal looks like - Politico
articles.description: Trump’s overriding desire to stop the bloodshed helps explain why the details of the plan remain fluid.

articles.title: NFL Power Rankings, Week 13: Patriots crack top five; Eagles, Bills, Steelers and Bucs all tumble - NFL.com
articles.description: More than two-thirds of teams are on the move in Eric Edholm's fresh batch of NFL Power Rankings. How high do the Patriots and Bears fly? How low do the Eagles and Bills go? Check out the fully updated pecking order, 1-32.

articles.title: Syrians displaced by war are returning to find homes occupied by foreign fighters - NPR
articles.description: Fighters have settled across northern Syria, surprising displaced Syrians who've tried to return to their homes. Nearly a year after the war's end, sorting out property ownership remains a pressing issue.

aiSummary:
The current news cycle is dominated by heightened political and legal tensions, notably set against the backdrop of President Donald Trump's second term. Legal battles are unfolding, with Rep. Eric Swalwell suing a former Trump housing official responsible for making criminal referrals against several Trump critics, including prominent figures like Sen. Adam Schiff and New York AG Letitia James. Simultaneously, the FBI is seeking interviews with six Democratic lawmakers whom Trump accused of "seditious behavior," raising concerns about political intimidation. These developments highlight a deeply polarized political landscape, where legal mechanisms are increasingly intertwined with partisan conflict.

In the technology and business sectors, Artificial Intelligence is a major driving force, ushering in both opportunities and disruptions. The stock market experienced volatility, with the Nasdaq sinking and Nvidia's shares dropping amidst an intensifying AI chip rivalry, as Alphabet rallied and Amazon advanced its own AI chip initiatives. This technological shift is also impacting the workforce, with HP announcing significant job cuts – between 4,000 and 6,000 employees – partly due to a missed profit outlook and the increased adoption of AI tools for efficiency. For consumers, the rising cost of memory components has made building PCs considerably more expensive.

Overall, the prevailing themes point to a dynamic period characterized by ongoing political contention, significant technological transformation driven by AI, and economic shifts affecting both corporations and consumers. Key concerns include the potential for continued political polarization, the economic impact of AI-driven job displacement, and market volatility. In other notable news, D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser announced she would not seek a fourth term, while international investigators continue to make arrests in the high-profile Louvre jewelry heist, though the stolen jewels remain unrecovered.
